title: San Francisco Unicorns switch gears with Toyota partnership
body:
The San Francisco Unicorns franchise of the US’ Major League Cricket (MLC) Twenty20 competition has secured a new official partner for the 2025 campaign, bringing in major car manufacturer Toyota’s Northern California Toyota Dealers regional franchise.

This partnership will see Toyota branding appear on Unicorns matchday trousers throughout the 2025 MLC campaign.

Furthermore, Toyota will also serve as the title sponsor of the team’s ‘2025 San Francisco Unicorns Family Day’ community engagement activation.

Pivot Agency, the sports marketing agency, brokered the deal on behalf of the San Francisco Unicorns, which it boasts as a client.

Speaking on the partnership, San Francisco Unicorns chief executive David White has stated: “As a team and an organization, we aspire to work with leading brands in their respective fields and Toyota is exactly that. Both as kit sponsors and as the key partner for our burgeoning Family Day event, we’re confident this will be a first-rate collaboration that drives awareness to both parties in 2025.

“Toyota is a household name and a byword for quality. Having them on board as partners shows both our commitment to collaborating with the best, as well as their own recognition of the Unicorns' deep roots in, and value to, the Bay Area.”

Major League Cricket begins on June 12, and will run through its July 13 final, with this season being the first that the Unicorns will compete on home turf courtesy of a multi-year stadium agreement with the Oakland Coliseum.

Recently, Major League Cricket appointed Johnny Grave as its new chief executive.

In the role, he will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of MLC's operations, including league expansion (it first launched in 2023), team development, and strategic partnerships.

Grave served as CEO of Cricket West Indies (CWI) for seven years up until October 2024, and has nearly 25 years of leadership experience in international cricket.

During his tenure with CWI, he oversaw three World Cups hosted in the West Indies and was the CEO for the 2024 men's T20 World Cup co-hosted with the US last June.
summary:
* The San Francisco Unicorns, a franchise in the Major League Cricket (MLC) competition, has secured Toyota's Northern California Toyota Dealers as an official partner for the 2025 campaign.
* The 2025 MLC campaign will begin on June 12 and end with the final on July 13.
* The San Francisco Unicorns will compete on home turf at the Oakland Coliseum, courtesy of a multi-year stadium agreement.
* Johnny Grave has been appointed as the new chief executive of Major League Cricket, responsible for overseeing league expansion, team development, and strategic partnerships.
* Major League Cricket was first launched in 2023, and Grave brings nearly 25 years of leadership experience in international cricket to his new role.

title: San Francisco Unicorns collaborate with Hexaware to boost fan engagement – Intelligent CIO North America
body:
MLC team and tech solutions provider look to shape the future of cricket in the US.

Hexaware Technologies has entered a new collaboration with Major League Cricket (MLC) team the San Francisco Unicorns.

The collaboration – extending through the 2026 league season – aligns with the digital transformation provider’s efforts in promoting sports by offering curated solutions to enhance fan and community engagement.

As part of the association, the technology solutions company will be recognized as a San Francisco Unicorns’ Official Partner. In addition to featuring Hexaware branding on the team’s helmets and caps, the company will also receive a perimeter signage display.

The collaboration illustrates a broader tech-industry that has companies investing in sports to showcase their capabilities.

Hexaware leverages technology to deliver innovative solutions that support customers in their digital transformation journeys and manage subsequent operations effectively. By optimizing processes, providing actionable insights, and enabling digital transformation at scale, Hexaware helps businesses enhance outcomes, streamline operations and reduce IT costs.

The Unicorns third MLC season starts in summer 2025 and, for the first time, MLC cricket will be played in the Bay area – with the Oakland Coliseum, previously home to the MLB’s Oakland Athletics and NFL’s Oakland Raiders, hosting matches.

“We are excited to welcome Hexaware Technologies as an Official Partner of the San Francisco Unicorns. Their efforts to innovate and excel align with our vision for the future of cricket,” said Anand Rajaraman, Co-Owner, San Francisco Unicorns.

“This collaboration not only enhances our team’s capabilities but also strengthens our connection with fans and communities around the globe.”

As Official Partner to the Unicorns, Hexware is looking to leverage its technology to enhance fan engagement through optimised digital experiences.

Against tough audience share competition from the more established US sports, MLC is looking to strengthen a growing presence in that market.

“At Hexaware, we are passionate about leveraging technology to create extraordinary experiences and partnering with the San Francisco Unicorns is a testament to that. Together, we look forward to help bring innovation to the dynamic world of cricket and engaging with fans in meaningful and impactful ways,” said R Srikrishna, CEO and Executive Director, Hexaware.

The collaboration is seen as having the potential to transform the way present – and future – US cricket fans engage with the game with the integration of Hexware’s data analytics, cloud computing and AI-driven engagement solutions.

Initiatives include personalized fan base experiences, online engagement, streamlined digital content delivery and use of real-time analytics.

Attracting significant Silicon Valley and US tech investment, Major League Cricket (MLC) is a professional Twenty20 cricket league in the US that started play in 2023.

For the 2025 season, MLC is made up of six teams – San Francisco Unicorns, MI New York, Los Angeles Knight Riders, SeattleOrcas, Texas Super Kings and Washington Freedom.

The six play a shortened fast-pace form of the game known as T20 with the two contesting teams having a single innings each – restricted to a maximum of twenty overs. A typical Twenty20 game takes around three and a half hours. Each innings lasts around 90 minutes with a 10-minute break between the innings.

One of the six founding members of MLC in 2023, the Unicorns primary investors are Silicon Valley entrepreneurs Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan – with a vision to bring the ‘electrifying spectacle’ of T20 cricket to the heart of California’s tech hub.

Cricket Victoria, the governing body for the sport in the Australian state of Victoria, serves as the Unicorns’ high-performance partner.

Former Australian all-rounder Shane Watson serves as Head Coach.

In its sophomore MLC season, the San Francisco Unicorns experienced remarkable growth securing the signing of international cricket superstar Pat Cummins.

Boasting a roster of world-renowned stars, the Unicorns reached the 2024 Championship final.

In March 2025, Hexware was confirmed as an official partner to the team.

“We are excited to welcome Hexaware Technologies as an Official Partner of the San Francisco Unicorns. Their efforts to innovate and excel align with our vision for the future of cricket,” said David White, CEO, San Francisco Unicorns.
summary:
**MLC Team San Francisco Unicorns Partners with Hexaware Technologies**

* The San Francisco Unicorns, an MLC team, has partnered with Hexaware Technologies, a digital transformation provider, as an official partner until the 2026 league season.
* The partnership aims to enhance fan engagement through optimized digital experiences, leveraging Hexaware's technology solutions.

**MLC Season Details**

* The San Francisco Unicorns' third MLC season starts in summer 2025, with matches to be played at the Oakland Coliseum in the Bay Area.
* The MLC consists of six teams: San Francisco Unicorns, MI New York, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.
* The teams play a shortened fast-paced form of the game called T20, with each game lasting around three and a half hours.

**San Francisco Unicorns Background**

* The Unicorns were one of the six founding members of MLC in 2023, with primary investors Anand Rajaraman and Venky Harinarayan aiming to bring T20 cricket to the heart of California's tech hub.
* Cricket Victoria serves as the Unicorns' high-performance partner, and former Australian all-rounder Shane Watson is the Head Coach.
* In the 2024 season, the Unicorns reached the Championship final, featuring a roster of world-renowned stars, including Pat Cummins.

title: Broadcast Intern - Major League Cricket
body:
---

Title: Broadcast Intern

Location: Dallas, TX | Oakland, CA | Fort Lauderdale, FL

Job Type: Internship (Paid)

Duration: Various (depending on location - June & July 2025)

---

Position Overview

Major League Cricket is seeking a passionate and hard-working Broadcast Intern to support the league’s production and broadcast operations. This role will provide hands-on experience in the execution of live sports broadcasts, working closely with MLC’s in-house team, production partners, and broadcast vendors. The ideal candidate is eager to learn the technical and operational side of sports media, and thrives in fast-paced, live event settings.

Responsibilities

Match-Day Production Support

Assist with setup and teardown of broadcast infrastructure at match venues

Support coordination between on-site crew, production vendors, and MLC staff

Help manage comms, credentials, and access for media/broadcast teams on match days

Shadow and support control room, camera, or ENG crew as needed

Monitor and log key moments during broadcasts for post-match archiving

Pre-Event Operations

Assist with the planning and logistics for each broadcast (e.g., crew schedules, equipment needs, transmission testing)

Prepare production documents such as run-of-show, transmission notes, and tech specs

Coordinate equipment shipping and inventory tracking for venue setups

Post-Event Deliverables

Help collect and organize video highlights, match files, and archive footage

Contribute to post-match reporting, clip labeling, and metadata entry

Support internal teams with broadcast assets for marketing and commercial use

Additional Support

Help coordinate digital content capture (e.g., behind-the-scenes, social-specific cuts)

Participate in production meetings and contribute to creative ideation

Assist with maintaining media libraries and cloud storage organization

Qualifications

Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Broadcast Journalism, Media Production, Sports Management, or a related field

Strong interest in sports broadcasting, live production, and the technical side of media

Availability to work flexible hours including nights, weekends, and travel during events

Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

Familiarity with cameras, editing software, and/or live production tools is a plus

Strong communicator who can work effectively in high-pressure environments

Passion for cricket, live sports, or broadcast media is highly preferred

What You’ll Gain

Hands-on experience in professional broadcast production at live sporting events

Exposure to the workflows of national and international sports broadcasting

Access to industry professionals, vendors, and media talent

Practical knowledge in broadcast logistics, content delivery, and live operations

Opportunity to contribute to the growth of cricket in the United States

About Major League Cricket

Major League Cricket (MLC) is the first professional Twenty20 cricket league in the United States, featuring top international talent alongside the best domestic players. With the rapid growth of cricket in the U.S. and a successful inaugural season under our belt, MLC is building a world-class sports property focused on fan experience, innovation, and commercial excellence.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: MI New York Announces Signings For Major League Cricket 2025
body:
MI New York has unveiled an impressive roster of players for the 2025 edition of Major League Cricket (MLC), set to begin on June 13.

The franchise will be bolstered by the presence of high-profile international cricketers, including South African duo Quinton de Kock and George Linde, Afghanistan’s Naveen-ul-Haq and Azmatullah Omarzai, as well as New Zealand’s Michael Bracewell, who is currently leading the national team in their white-ball series against Pakistan.

Retained And New Players To Strengthen MI New York’s Squad

The new signings join a mix of retained players, both international and domestic, who have been key to MI New York’s success in previous seasons.

Overseas stars like Nicholas Pooran, Kieron Pollard, Rashid Khan, and Trent Boult will continue their association with the team, while the domestic squad includes Monank Patel, Nosthush Kenjige, Heath Richards, Ehsan Adil, Rushil Ugarkar, and Sunny Patel.

Additionally, the squad will feature 2025 draft picks Agni Chopra, Kunwarjeet Singh, Sharad Lumba, and Tajinder Singh.

Familiar Faces Among The Signings

Quinton de Kock returns to MI after a successful IPL stint (2019-2021), where he helped MI win two titles.

George Linde, who played a key role in MI Cape Town’s 2025 title-winning campaign in the SA20, is also back with the MI family.

Linde has been part of the team since the inaugural season in 2023 and will add valuable experience to the MI New York squad.

Azmatullah Omarzai, the Men’s ODI Cricketer of the Year for 2024, brings his all-around capabilities to MI New York.

Having played alongside Rashid Khan, Trent Boult, and George Linde in MI Cape Town’s title-winning squad, Omarzai will be eager to contribute to the team’s success.

Naveen-ul-Haq and Michael Bracewell will also be vital assets in MI New York’s quest for a second MLC title in three years.

Both players have the pedigree to make a significant impact on the team’s performance in the upcoming season.

MI New York Bid Farewell

MI New York parted ways with key players like Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Dewald Brevis, Tim David, and Romario Shepherd ahead of the 2025 MLC season.

The team also parted ways with local players Steven Taylor, Rueben Clinton, and Shayan Jahangir as they reshaped the squad for the new campaign.

Heartbreak In 2024: Defending Champions’ Early Exit

Despite being the defending champions in the 2024 season, MI New York faced a crushing defeat in the eliminator match against Texas Super Kings.

The Texas team executed a flawless plan, defeating MI New York by a comprehensive 9-wicket victory and ending their title defense prematurely.

MI New York 2025 Squad

The finalized squad for MI New York for the 2025 MLC season is as follows:

Kieron Pollard

Nicholas Pooran

Trent Boult

Rashid Khan

Monank Patel

Nosthush Kenjige

Heath Richards

Ehsan Adil

Sunny Patel

George Linde

Quinton de Kock

Michael Bracewell

Naveen-ul-Haq

Azmatullah Omarzai

Kunwarjeet Singh

Sharad Lumba

Tajinder Singh

Agni Chopra

MI New York aims to reclaim the MLC title with a mix of experienced internationals and promising domestic talent.

title: Seattle Orcas bring in stars Matthew Mott, Ian Bell, and Munaf Patel in GMR-backed coaching revamp
body:
The Seattle Orcas are gearing up for a new chapter in Major League Cricket under CEO Hemant Dua, who has reshaped the franchise’s cricket operations with a highly experienced coaching staff and a strategic vision aimed at long-term consistency and success.

When Dua was appointed in May 2024, just ahead of the second MLC season, he had little time to influence the setup. Now, with a full off-season behind him, the transformation is in full swing.

“We have made big changes in our setup,” Dua told cricexec, “and we’ve got a completely new set of support staff and coaching staff, except for a few that have continued from last year.”

“I want to thank the old coaching staff for their efforts,” Dua continued, “and welcome the new staff to the Seattle Orcas family.”

The Seattle Orcas quickly made a splash in the MLC, reaching the finals in the inaugural 2023 season. Behind the scenes, they are backed by an influential ownership group that blends deep cricket expertise with global business leadership.

The Orcas are co-owned by a group of tech and business leaders—Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Soma Somasegar, Sanjay Parthasarathy, Samir Bodas, and Ashok Krishnamurthi—alongside a major cricket force: GMR Group.

GMR Group, headquartered in New Delhi, is a global infrastructure conglomerate with operations across airports, energy, transportation, urban infrastructure and sports. GMR Sports, the sports arm of the group, is a significant player in global sports, particularly cricket, led by their Corporate Chairman, Kiran Kumar Grandhi. They co-own the Delhi Capitals in the IPL, the Delhi Capitals Women’s team in the WPL, the Dubai Capitals in the ILT20, the UP Yoddha in the Pro Kabaddi League, and have recently acquired Hampshire Cricket and the Southern Brave in The Hundred.

Orcas CEO Dua knows this system well—he spent several years working for GMR, including as CEO of the Delhi Daredevils/Capitals in the franchise’s first six seasons.

“I want to acknowledge the support that we’re getting from GMR Sports, who are obviously one of the investors in the team, especially on the cricket side of the business,” Dua said.

“I would also like to add that I am blessed to have support from the rest of the ownership group, especially Soma Somasegar and Sanjay Parthasarthy who work closely with me on the vision and strategy for the growth of the Seattle Orcas.”

That alignment is central to how the Orcas are being rebuilt—from top-tier coaching to operational expertise.

Venugopal Rao: a proven cricket brain at the helm of operations

Steering the franchise’s cricketing strategy from the front office will be Venugopal Rao, the Orcas’ new GM of Cricket Operations. A former India international who represented the national side in both ODIs and Tests, Rao brings not only the credibility of an elite player but also years of experience in building successful teams in the IPL and ILT20.

“He’s now the Director of Cricket for the IPL’s Delhi Capitals,” Dua said. “And he was also the Director of Cricket at Dubai Capitals, who won their first trophy this year. That was the first major cricket trophy for GMR other than the Legends trophy they had won a few years ago.”

Venu is well-known within the GMR Sports ecosystem. He played for the Delhi Daredevils (now Capitals) from 2011 to 2013, a period when Hemant Dua himself was part of the franchise leadership.

“He’s known to all of us really well,” Dua noted. “He brings in a wealth of experience and we’re hoping that we’ll go in that right direction.”

Matthew Mott leads a new era on the field

At the center of the coaching rebuild is Head Coach Matthew Mott, a widely respected leader with a résumé that includes winning the Men’s T20 World Cup in 2022 with England and previously leading Australia’s women to a T20 World Cup title in 2020.

“I’m incredibly excited to be joining the Seattle Orcas for the MLC,” Mott said. “It’s a fantastic opportunity to be part of a growing competition, and I can’t wait to work with the players, owners, and staff at the Orcas to build towards long-term, sustainable success.”

His commitment to the Orcas is already clear: “I’m looking forward to the challenge and contributing to a successful season both on and off the field… It will be fantastic to engage with the growing cricket community as we prepare for an exciting campaign ahead.”

Dua explained the hire: “He was shortlisted amongst a bunch of interviews that we did… but we zeroed down on Matthew Mott because of the philosophy and the energy and his passion for actually building teams over a period of time.”

“Matthew’s a great guy. He brings in a wealth of cricket experience. He’s passionate about the game. He’s passionate about youngsters. He wants to nurture them, build them, and he’s not looking at this as a one-year assignment,” Dua added. “He’s looking at it as a long-term assignment. So we’re kind of hoping that not just this year where we do well, but we do well consistently.”

The chemistry of champions: Ian Bell and Munaf Patel

Joining Mott on the coaching bench are two well-known names from the international cricket scene: Ian Bell as Batting Coach and Munaf Patel as Bowling Coach.

Bell, a former England Test stalwart, is one of the most technically sound batters of his era. Over a 12-year international career, he amassed more than 7,000 Test runs, including 22 centuries, and was a mainstay of England’s middle order during their rise to No. 1 in the world.

Patel, meanwhile, brings pace, experience, and World Cup-winning pedigree. The former Indian fast bowler played a key role in India’s triumphant 2011 campaign and was known for his control and composure in pressure moments.

“Again, both are cricketers with immense wealth of experience,” Dua said. “Ian is known as one of the top English batsmen in his time. He played well and I don’t need to repeat his achievements. And so is Munaf, right? Munaf’s a great bowler—was a top pace bowler of his time, and part of a World Cup-winning squad. He’s loved by the youngsters, and I am confident he will be of great help to our bowling unit with his rich experience.”

Crucially, both Bell and Patel have worked together with the Dubai Capitals, alongside Rao and Hemang Badani (also the Delhi Capitals’ Head Coach), where they recently lifted a title—making them a cohesive unit.

“They’ll be working with the same people and Matthew Mott in the Delhi Capitals,” Dua said. “One of the reasons why everyone’s coming on board together is, besides the wealth of experience that they bring, is the understanding. When you keep working together, you get to know your colleagues really well.”

“To me, that’s amazing because then the transition is much easier wherever you’re working globally… Rather than trying to work with new staff every time.”

Strategic synergy across GMR-owned teams

This cohesive staff setup isn’t accidental—it’s the result of intentional alignment with GMR Sports, which is finding synergy in its ownership stakes across Delhi Capitals, Dubai Capitals, and Hampshire Cricket.

“There is a lot of overlap in the staff that is going to be running this year’s cricket for us,” Dua said. “That for us helps when they come in here. They know each other. They understand each other’s energy.”

The Orcas are looking to replicate that successful structure in the US cricket landscape, aiming for consistent results on and off the field.

Maintaining key continuity

While the coaching team has been refreshed, a few key figures remain. Most notably, USA coach Rishi Bhardwaj continues in his Orcas role, helping bridge domestic and international player integration.

“Rishi… stays on because he’s in the US. He understands the US domestic players well,” Dua said. “He brings that wealth of experience which would be required by the staff that will be coming from other tournaments because they wouldn’t understand the domestic boys that well. He’s the bridge between the domestic talent and the coaching staff.”

Built for the long haul

The Seattle Orcas rebuild is more than cosmetic. It’s rooted in scouting, data, and deliberate planning. Dua and his colleague Jagan Nemani (Sr. VP Operations), along with Rishi and Ross Taylor attended domestic games across the country and entered the draft with the largest purse to secure top talent.

“I feel U.S. cricket has got huge potential,” Dua said. “The youngsters coming out there are amazing, and they need a few years before they can fully unleash them. The Minor League is a great platform for them to showcase their talent. All in all, it was a great exposure for me.”

With the foundation now set, the Seattle Orcas aren’t just aiming to bounce back — they’re building a cricketing setup for the long term.

“We want a team not just for this year, but for the future,” Dua said. “We want to be consistently performing well out there on the field and off the field.”
summary:
* The Seattle Orcas, a team in the Major League Cricket (MLC), is undergoing a transformation under CEO Hemant Dua, who has reshaped the franchise's cricket operations with a new coaching staff and a strategic vision for long-term consistency and success.
* The team has made significant changes, including the appointment of Venugopal Rao as General Manager of Cricket Operations, who brings his experience from the IPL and ILT20 leagues.
* The coaching staff has been refreshed, with Matthew Mott as the new Head Coach, who has a proven track record of winning the Men's T20 World Cup with England and the Women's T20 World Cup with Australia.
* Ian Bell and Munaf Patel have joined the coaching bench as Batting Coach and Bowling Coach, respectively, both bringing their wealth of experience from international cricket.
* The team is aiming to replicate the successful structure of GMR Sports, which owns several teams across different leagues, including the Delhi Capitals in the IPL and the Dubai Capitals in the ILT20.
* The Orcas are looking to build a consistent and successful cricketing setup for the long term, with a focus on scouting, data, and deliberate planning.
* The team has retained some key figures, including USA coach Rishi Bhardwaj, who will help bridge domestic and international player integration.
* The ultimate goal is to build a team that performs consistently well on and off the field, with a focus on the future rather than just the current season.

title: Big news just came in the middle of IPL 2025, Mumbai bought KKR’s explosive opener
body:
IPL 2025: A big news has come out in the middle of IPL 2025. The 5th match of the season was played between Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad in which KKR registered a big win by 80 runs. After this match, big news has come about Kolkata’s (IPL 2025) star opener Quinton de Kock. Left-handed star opener Quinton de Kock has returned to the Mumbai Indians family after 4 years. However, this return will not be in the IPL but with the MI New York team in America’s Major League Cricket (MLC). MI New York has also confirmed De Kock’s return to the MI family by sharing a post on social media.

These players enter MI for Major League Cricket 2025

Along with Quinton de Kock, South African all-rounder George Linde will also join MI New York. Linde performed brilliantly in the SA20 League and played a key role in MI Cape Town winning their first title. Not only this, Afghan fast bowler Naveen ul Haq will also leave Texas Super Kings and join MI New York. MI New York has retained its key players Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult and Rashid Khan for the upcoming season of the Major League Cricket League.

How was Quinton de Kock’s performance in IPL 2025?

Quinton de Kock is currently playing IPL 2025. So far in the 18 seasons, he has scored 103 runs in 4 matches. He could only score 1-1 against Sunrisers Hyderabad and Mumbai Indians, but he played an unbeaten innings of 97 runs against Rajasthan Royals. He scored 4 runs against Royal Challengers Bangalore. KKR hopes that de Kock’s bat will make a splash in the upcoming matches.
summary:
* Quinton de Kock, the star opener of Kolkata Knight Riders, has returned to the Mumbai Indians family after 4 years, but this time with the MI New York team in America's Major League Cricket (MLC).
* Along with de Kock, South African all-rounder George Linde and Afghan fast bowler Naveen ul Haq will also join MI New York.
* MI New York has retained its key players Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Trent Boult, and Rashid Khan for the upcoming season of the Major League Cricket League.

Note that the article does not mention the schedule or any specific details about the upcoming season of Major League Cricket, but it provides information about the team compositions and player movements.
